sub_title: Strategy & Workforce Analytics Leader - International (Sr. Principal)
summary:
My professional goals are simple: to always do my best, network whenever possible and to establish win-win partnerships within new markets.

Throughout my career I have consulted on a number of large scale change management projects with clients  across different industries including: Banking, Logistics, FMCG, Tech and with International Governments.

Specialties: 
Leading project teams,
Acquisition & Business Development, 
Human Capital Metrics and Analytics,
Information and data sales,
Formulating and implementing commercial strategies,
Stakeholder management,
Client Relationship Management,
Increasing client portfolios and growing brand awareness,
Presentation & Public speaking

projects.title: Guardians of Justice
projects.description: This project aims to help bring more justice to citizens by empowering local civil society organisations (CSOs) – Guardians of Justice - with the tools and mechanisms for monitoring justice as experienced by the people. Guardians engage justice delivery organisations; courts, Bar associations, legislative bodies, village elders etc. to improves their processes to deliver more and better justice. HiiL and the Guardians will collect robust evidence about the justice needs of the people, the costs and quality of access to justice. This knowledge will be processed into a series of reports focusing on particular justice challenges. These civil society organisations are placed at centre-stage of the project and are empowered, in a partnership with HiiL, to become Guardians of Justice, thus giving voice to the people and instigating innovative and evidence-based change processes, tailored to local needs.

profile_positions.description:
- Leading an analytical team responsible for selling and executing projects across 42 countries 
- Deep experience in managing organization design and strategic workforce planning projects with Fortune 500 companies 
- Location strategy expert,  from site selection to implementation - over 250 projects completed
- Extensive experience in the world of talent intelligence,  expert understanding of international talent markets from a labour market supply, demand, quality and cost perspective 
- Keen advocate of the concept "living wage" and "pay equity" - multiple projects completed within this field
profile_positions.title: Strategy & Workforce Analytics Leader - International - Sr. Principal

profile_positions.description:
- David is a principal consultant at Mercer. He currently holds the joint positions of European Financial Services & Insurance leader and is the co-leader of Mercer’s site selection practice. 

- David has a deep interest in exploring the future of work and the impact that key trends (such as Robot Process Automation, Artificial Intelligence etc.) will have on company's future business models, location and people strategies. Once these impacts have been defined, David advises his clients -  utilizing Mercer’s leading technology solutions and industry insights – on how best to prepare for the future.

- David is a strong advocate of evidence based decision making and believes that HR can and should do more to leverage internal and external data sources to support the business and people related challenges that their organizations encounter.
profile_positions.title: Financial Services & Insurance Leader - Europe & Site Selection co-Leader - Principal

company.name: HiiL | Hague Institute for Internationalisation of Law

profile_positions.description:
-Head of the 'Measuring & Evaluation' commercial team (8FTEs) - Justice Information and Data team
-Responsible for creating, formulating and executing the commercial strategy (market mapping and analysis; business development strategy and relationship management strategy, creation of marketing materials) and coaching of team members within the ‘Measuring and Evaluation’ and ‘Justice Innovation Lab’ (Justice Strategy) product group. 
-Responsible for new business development and acquisition of prospective clients and project partners. Clients include: World Bank, United Nations Development Program, Ministry of Foreign Affairs (such as Dutch, British, German, Japanese, United States of America), Management consultancies such as CGI, CARDNO, Philanthropic Foundations such as Ford Foundation, George Soros Open Foundation, BAR Associations, Lawyers and Judges. 
-Global business development responsibility. Acquisition activities conducted in countries such as: Indonesia, Bulgaria, Uganda, Kenya, Mongolia, Caucausus (Armenia, Georgia), Western Balkans  Macedonia etc., Yemen, Nepal, Bangladesh, and Canada 
-Manages projects and proposals. Ensures proposals and tenders adhere to specific client theory and are delivered on time. Proposals include: Country specific political economy analysis, Risk assessment & mitigation strategies, Contextual Analysis, Project Budgetary requirements, Gantt Charts. Process includes the organization and execution of intensive SCRUM sessions to generate proposal content – a multi stakeholder process.
-Projects include:  Guardians of Justice, Rule of Law Quick Scan Project, Program Generation Tool, Rule of Law Navigator Tool, Justice Needs and Satisfaction Tool, Justice data reports: Yemen, Mali, Netherlands, Indonesia, Uganda
profile_positions.title: Client Relationship Manager
